info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 5 at 6:47PM EDT until June 5 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following county, Leon.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tallahassee, Florida A and M, Southwood, Tom Brown Park, Indian Head Acres, Governors Square Mall, Apalachee Ridge Estates, Jack McLean Park, Gene Cox Stadium, J R Alford Greenway, South City, North Florida Fairgrounds, Cascades Park, Apalachee Regional Park, All Saints District, Walker Ford Community Center, Bragg Stadium, Gaither Community Center, Springsax Park and Providence Neighborhood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING
